items.title: Cold-spike load risk scenario for central grid regions
items.summary: Signals point to a short-duration cold air mass scenario that could drive heating load spikes in central grid footprints. Expect higher-than-normal stress windows on transmission corridors and reserve margins if the signal materializes. Grid operators and dispatchers should be on scenario watch for sustained peak hour demand.
watchlist: day-ahead and real-time demand forecasts for Midwest/Rockies zones
reserve activation notices and emergency demand response signals
items.action_for_readers: Review contingency dispatch plans and confirm reserve procurement and demand-response rostering for next 72 hours.

EPCs and asset owners should scenario-plan for staggered deliveries and commissioning delays.

items.title: Aging-oil transformer thermal stress scenario
items.summary: Signals of prolonged high ambient temperature stress increase the scenario risk of thermal-related faults in older oil-filled transformers. Consequences could include localized outage windows and increased fire risk if maintenance is deferred. Asset owners should prioritize thermal monitoring and contingency plans for key substation assets.
watchlist: transformer top-oil temperature trends and dissolved gas analysis flags

items.action_for_readers: Run thermal scans and DGA reviews on high-risk transformers and stage firefighting readiness at critical substations.
